ygData.subject: Re: General Question about getting items into invento ry.
ygData.msgSnippet: Ok, so you cast the summon spell, then drop it?  Summon something else and then drop it? On the ground. Hmmm, I guess that could be good because you then pick
ygData.messageBody:
Ok, so you cast the summon spell, then drop it? Summon something else and
then drop it?

On the ground.

Hmmm, I guess that could be good because you then pick it up, it auto puts
you into the inventory screen, but can you pick up the next thing without
exiting the inventory screen.

Bayne

Jay S Howard
Technical Recruiter
jhoward@...
http://www.arristech.com
602-957-3787


-->-----Original Message-----
-->From: Bill Butler [mailto:bbutler@...]
-->Sent: Wednesday, May 12, 1999 1:02 PM
-->To: _EQ_Magic@onelist.com
-->Subject: Re: [_EQ_Magic] General Question about getting items into
-->invento ry.
-->
-->
-->From: "Bill Butler" <bbutler@...>
-->
-->Ok well i dont think ill change my way of doing it.. because
-->you have to target the
-->bag.. if u miss.. oops. you drop it and no message..
-->
-->Here what i do..Any i have several thing i summon when i get on.
-->You can summon a water, food,bandages,weapon, Persona , Drop.
-->repeat.. It wont look like you have the other items but you do.
-->
-->the advantages to this is while one spell resets you cast another.
-->
-->
-->Good luck
-->Akdov - veeshan
-->
-->

-->>

--><kevink@...> --> -->> Is
-->> there an easier way to do this from the Wide screen? -->>
--> -->> Bayne,
-->> Shaman Barbarian frusturated with the tediousness -->of summoning
-->> -->water. --> --> >>You can make an inventory spot a hot
-->button. So put
-->> -->that slot as a hot --> >>button, and just drop it there.
-->> --> >>Sonoroud, Dark Elf Nercomancer --> -->I also
-->favor the approach of
-->> opening a bag and then doing my -->summoning while it's
-->sitting open on my
-->> main screen. --> -->-- Magistris, High Elf Magician -->
-->--> --> --> -->
